Cockatoos

Slender-Billed Cockatoo

A type of Corella from Australia, this white cockatoo is distinguished by its very long, slender upper beak, which it uses for digging up roots and tubers. They have a pink splash around the face.

Origin
Australia & Oceania
Size
15-16 inches (38-41 cm). Weight: 500-650g (17.5-23 oz)
Weight
575g avg.
Noise Level
Very Loud. They have a loud, multi-part call that can be very noisy.

Looking for a Slender-Billed Cockatoo?

See Available Slender-Billed Cockatoo Listings

Species Ratings

Talking Ability 1/10
Noise Level 9/10
Social Needs 6/10
Cuddliness 9/10

Temperament & Personality

Extremely intelligent, playful, and can be very affectionate. They are known for being one of the best talkers among the cockatoos. They have a strong instinct to dig and chew.

Vocalization & Talking Ability

Considered one of the best talkers of all cockatoos, capable of learning extensive vocabularies with remarkable clarity.

Dietary Needs

A pelleted diet with lots of fresh vegetables. They need a constant supply of wood and other safe materials to chew to satisfy their digging and chewing instincts.

Health & Lifespan

Can live for 70+ years. Beak can become overgrown if not provided with sufficient chewing opportunities. They can be prone to behavioral issues if bored.

Housing Requirements

Not suitable for apartments. Requires a very large, extremely durable cage with lots of wood to destroy. Minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48"H.

Common Questions About Slender-Billed Cockatoo

What is the lifespan of a Slender-Billed Cockatoo?

The Slender-Billed Cockatoo typically lives for 70+ years. With proper care, diet, and regular vet check-ups, they can live a full and healthy life.

Is the Slender-Billed Cockatoo good for beginners?

This species is rated as 'advanced' care level. They require specific attention, socialization, or dietary needs that may challenge first-time owners.

Where does the Slender-Billed Cockatoo come from?

The Slender-Billed Cockatoo is native to Australia & Oceania.
